framework_info.name: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5
framework_info.description: Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems and Organizations
framework_info.organization: National Institute of Standards and Technology

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate access control policy and procedures.
controls.supplemental_guidance: Access control policy and procedures for the controls in the AC family implemented within systems and organizations.

controls.title: Account Management
controls.description: Manage information system accounts including establishing, activating, modifying, reviewing, disabling, and removing accounts.
controls.supplemental_guidance: Account management applies to all account types including individual, shared, group, system, guest, anonymous, emergency, developer, temporary, and service accounts.

control_enhancements.title: Automated System Account Management
control_enhancements.description: Support the management of system accounts using automated mechanisms.

control_enhancements.title: Automated Temporary and Emergency Account Management
control_enhancements.description: Automatically remove or disable temporary and emergency accounts.

control_enhancements.title: Disable Accounts
control_enhancements.description: Disable accounts within an organization-defined time period when the accounts have been inactive.

controls.title: Access Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources.
controls.supplemental_guidance: Access control policies control access between active entities or subjects and passive entities or objects.

controls.title: Authenticator Management
controls.description: Manage system authenticators by verifying the identity of the individual, group, role, or device.
controls.supplemental_guidance: Individual authenticators include passwords, tokens, biometrics, PKI certificates, and key cards.

control_enhancements.title: Password-Based Authentication
control_enhancements.description: For password-based authentication, maintain password policies and procedures.

control_enhancements.title: Automated Support for Password Strength Determination
control_enhancements.description: Employ automated tools to determine if password authenticators are sufficiently strong.

controls.title: Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: Determine the cryptographic uses and implement required cryptographic protections using cryptographic mechanisms.
controls.supplemental_guidance: Cryptographic mechanisms used by the system are employed in accordance with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines.

controls.title: Event Logging
controls.description: Identify the types of events that the system is capable of logging in support of the audit function.
controls.supplemental_guidance: An event is an observable occurrence in a system. The types of events that require logging are those events that are significant and relevant to the security of systems and the privacy of individuals.

controls.title: Configuration Settings
controls.description: Establish and document configuration settings for components employed within the system using security and privacy configuration checklists.
controls.supplemental_guidance: Configuration settings are the parameters that can be changed in the hardware, software, or firmware that affect the security and privacy posture or functionality of the system.
